紀.definition: order; discipline; age; era; period; to chronicle

紀伯倫.definition: Khalil Gibran (1883-1931), Lebanese poet, writer and artist

紀傳體.definition: history genre based on biography, such as Sima Qian's Record of the Historian

紀實.definition: record of actual events; documentary (factual rather than fictional)

紀年.definition: to number the years; calendar era; annals; chronicle

紀律檢查委員會.pinyin: jì lǜ jiǎn chá wěi yuán huì
紀律檢查委員會.definition: Central Commission for Discipline Inspection of the CCP

紀念.definition: to commemorate; to honor the memory of; memento; keepsake; souvenir

紀昀.definition: Ji Yun (1724-1805), Qing Dynasty writer, author of supernatural novel Notes on a Minutely Observed Thatched Hut 閱微草堂筆記|阅微草堂笔记

紀檢.definition: disciplinary inspection; to inspect another's discipline

紀要.definition: minutes; written summary of a meeting

紀錄.definition: variant of 記錄|记录[ji4 lu4] (but in Taiwan, not for the verb sense "to record")

紀錄片.definition: newsreel; documentary (film or TV program); CL:部[bu4]
